title: Software Engineering Intern (Summer 2024)
purpose: To assist in building a completely new underground transportation system, the Las Vegas Loop, by designing and developing tools for collecting, analyzing, and displaying data and graphs.
duties_responsibilities: Implement reliable and scalable Web services to monitor the Las Vegas Loop
Improve Loop operational efficiency by deploying web tools for various teams at The Boring Company
Formulate statistical metrics to evaluate the Las Vegas Loop performance
Develop and deploy web tools to display performance metrics
Clearly document and communicate design proposals
Support the Las Vegas Loop during hours of operations, eventually during weekends or holidays when necessary
required_qualifications: High School diploma or GED and currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent field
Prior experience in software development projects (industry or school)
Proficiency in 2 or more coding languages
Experience with Web Technologies: HTML, CSS, JS, Node.js and at least one of jQuery, React, Angular, Vue or similar
Understanding of how to develop Web APIs including concepts such as REST
Familiar with communication protocols, such as HTTP, TCP, UDP
preferred_qualifications: Ability to quickly adapt to new projects and learn new languages, technologies and concepts under tight time constraints
Experience with Computer Science competitions such as The International Olympiad in Informatics or Not-a-Boring-Competition
company_info: The Boring Company was founded to solve the problem of soul-destroying traffic by creating an underground network of tunnels. They aim to increase tunneling speed and decrease costs by a factor of 10 or more to make Hyperloop adoption viable. The company is focused on enabling rapid transit across densely populated regions.
